releases.title: v0.4.0
releases.body:
Instructions on using this pre-release can be found on the wiki. This software represents a raw version of a provider and should not be used in production.

FEATURES:

  • Application expose is now available.

NOTES:

  • Now the provider considers the current Juju status of expose and config for any application. When a plan is applied, this is compared with the current status returned by Juju and applied when required. For example, an exposed application can be manually unexposed using the Juju CLI. When applying the plan again, the provider will detect a mismatch and expose the application again.
  • The application configuration returned by Juju can contain more elements than the plan may contain. For this reason, the provider will only consider those parameteres already specified in the plan. This means that if any configuration parameter is manually set using the Juju CLI and this parameter is not set in the plan, no changes will be applied by the provider.

releases.title: v0.3.1
releases.body:
Instructions on using this pre-release can be found on the wiki. This software represents a raw version of a provider and should not be used in production.

NOTES:

  • provider: The provider has a dependency on Juju CLI configuration store. It expects configuration to be found in either $XDG_DATA_HOME/juju or ~/.local/share/juju.

BUG FIXES

  • resource/juju_application: Avoid inconsistency with a Charm’s self-reported name
  • resource/juju_application: Fix error encountered when changing units whilst operating on a CAAS model

What’s Changed

  • [JUJU-1593] Fix run_actions and facade issues by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/706
  • Release 3.0.1 notes by @juanmanuel-tirado in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/708

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/3.0.0…3.0.1

What’s Changed

Switching to semantic versioning. From this release on, at least the major release number matches the most recent Juju supported. Hence the jump to 3.0.0 since this release supports Juju 3.0. (This also means that python-libjuju <= 2.9.11 only support up to Juju 2.x)

  • [JUJU-1439] Initial fixes for test_model to pass with juju 3.0 by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/689
  • [JUJU-1464] More fixes for 3.0 compatibility by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/691
  • [JUJU-1457] Merge 3.0 compatibility branch onto master by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/692
  • Fix conditional by @sed-i in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/696
  • [JUJU-1534] Fix model.connect_current() by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/697
  • [JUJU-1542] Fix run actions on units by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/698
  • [JUJU-1577] Replace k8s bundles with machine bundles for tests by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/703
  • [JUJU-1528] Add storage implementation by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/701
  • [JUJU-1582] Release 3.0.0 notes by @cderici in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/704

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/compare/2.9.11…3.0.0

What’s Changed

  • Add REPL quickstart subsection by @sed-i in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/676
  • Revision of test onos.charm by @juanmanuel-tirado in https://github.com/juju/python-libjuju/pull/686

releases.title: v2.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • Expose PruneTxns in order to allow external tools to use it by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/16
  • Add progress logging while pruning transactions by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/17
  • Retry errors that finish with ‘unexpected message’. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • Add export_test.go by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/19
  • Use mgo.Collection.Bulk to prune docs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/20
  • Add RunTransaction observer by @axw in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/21
  • Use disk-based pruning strategy by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/22
  • Make prune log output consistent by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/23
  • Cleanup txn.Stash as part of regular pruning by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • Cleanup all collections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/25
  • Don’t create transactions that have no operations. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/27
  • Abstract out “Completed Transaction” functionality by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/26
  • Properly test no-op does the right thing, as does real errors. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/28
  • Add a command-line utility to clean and purge txns. by @cmars in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • Add logging information about the pruning result. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/29
  • Turns out it isn’t safe to use aggregation in 2.4 at all. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/31
  • support using RemoveAll($in) instead of Bulk. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/32
  • Various cleanups by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/35
  • track what is actually removed by Oracle.RemoveTxns() by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/34
  • Expose a NewestTime for PruneOptions. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/36
  • Handle Bulk.Run() result being nil by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/37
  • When observing transactions include the run Duration. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/40
  • Change Clock back to being optional. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/41
  • Allow passing in a parameter to limit the number of transactions evaluated by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/42
  • Expose the batch size and number of batches. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/43
  • No need for uint64 and it makes default printing ugly by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/44
  • Use juju/clock package for the clock. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/45
  • Incremental prune by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/46
  • 2.4 prune options by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/47
  • Pass the transaction attempt by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • Revert “Merge pull request #48 from SimonRichardson/txn-attempt” by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/51
  • Add testing.SetFailIfTransaction. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/49
  • Retry i/o timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/52
  • Thread through the transaction by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/50
  • juju/txn with server side transactions by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/55
  • Add help text to explain why hooks do not run by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • Properly handle when RemoveAll returns an error. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/57
  • Use github.com/juju/mgo/v2 and convert to go mod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/58
  • Add extra txn backoff tuning parameters for sstxn by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/59
  • Make retry fuzz a percent and use durations instead of floats by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/60
  • Update to go 1.17 and latest upstream by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/61
  • Add support for no change log, used when upgrading to SSTXN. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

New Contributors

  • @howbazaar made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/18
  • @jameinel made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/24
  • @cmars made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/30
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/48
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/56
  • @hpidcock made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/txn/pull/62

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/txn/commits/v2.0.0

releases.body:

  • Fix all the license headers. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/11

  • Devices for a Machine. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/36

  • Parse and return BlockDevices for Machines. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/40
  • Add ConstraintMatches.Storage by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/41
  • VLAN name is optional in 2.0 API schema by @dimitern in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/42
  • Use uint64 for blockdevice and partition sizes. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/43
  • Make dns_servers optional in subnets by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/44
  • Don’t return typed nil interface values by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/46
  • Use the correct VLAN in machine.CreateDevice by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/47
  • Make kflavor optional by @voidspace in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/49

  • Enable reading and setting machine owner data by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/57
  • Fix typo in operation name by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/gomaasapi/pull/58

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • httptesting: fix for Go 1.6 by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/93
  • testing: remove deprecated AddSuiteCleanup function by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/94
  • add PatchExecHelper and CaptureOutput helpers by @natefinch in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/95
  • Fix PatchExecHelper.GetExecCommand on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/96
  • Handle the error return from utils.SetHome(). by @ericsnowcurrently in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/97
  • testing: add TCPProxy.CloseConns by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/98
  • mgo: don’t panic while resetting admin password by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/99
  • Don’t drop and recreate the database between tests by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/100
  • testing: don’t panic during TearDownTest if SetUpTest failed by @davecheney in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/101
  • Added BSONEquals checker by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/103
  • Detect mongod version before starting test server by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/104
  • lp:1596045 handle CRLF in mongo version line by @babbageclunk in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/105
  • copy clock from juju/juju/testing by @jrwren in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/106
  • Update to use the latest loggo. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/107
  • Retry mgo dial if unexpected message. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/109
  • Hook up mgo logging and reconnect properly. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/110
  • add NewProxiedSession by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/111
  • implement Clock.NewTimer by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/108
  • Bump mongo error output to 100 lines by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/112
  • Update testing.Clock to improve robustness by @reedobrien in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/113
  • NewProxiedSession - ping to assign a socket to the returned session. by @alesstimec in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/114
  • checkers: ignore time zone in DeepEqual by @rogpeppe in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/115
  • MongoDB needs –key=value not –key value now by @dooferlad in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/116
  • Fixes for replicaset by @macgreagoir in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/117
  • Introduces a type which can be used to mock calls by @kat-co in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/118
  • tcpproxy: add pause and resume to the stream by @mhilton in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/119
  • Disable mgo logging/debugging by default by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/120
  • Mongo 3.4 uses a different string to indicate it is ready for connections by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/121
  • Fix EchoQuotedArgsUnix/AssertEchoArgs by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/122
  • Fix PatchExecutableAsEchoArgs on Windows by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/124
  • Prefer mongod 3.2 and improve mongod info caching by @mjs in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/123
  • Default mongo storage backend to mmapv1 by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/126
  • Add MgoInstance.SSLEnabled method by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/125
  • Remove deprecated –sslOnNormalPorts arg to mongod by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/127
  • Fix typo in mongo command by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/128
  • Stub check calls without order. by @anastasiamac in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/132
  • testing: default to mmapv1 only on x86(_64) by @axw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/133
  • Don’t try to truncate the local replicaset oplog. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/135
  • Changes to support Mongo 3.6. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/136
  • Expose the version of Mongo that we are testing against. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/137
  • enable vendor as the highest priority import path by @ycliuhw in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • Add short and long timeouts. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/139
  • Use juju/clock by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/140
  • Add the location of mongod in bionic to the list of places we look. by @howbazaar in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/141
  • Enable Mongo with Replica Sets by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/142
  • If using Replicaset use wiredTiger. by @jameinel in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/143
  • Add support for finding the juju-db snap when looking for mongod by @timClicks in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • Allow testing of DoRequest against status code by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145
  • Malformed errors by @SimonRichardson in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/146
  • Fix address already in use detection. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/147
  • Move to go mod + fix juju-db snap usage by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/148
  • Fix issue with juju suites overwriting HOME by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/149
  • Sidestep HOME env var for juju-db snap testing by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/150
  • Add multi-checker by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/151
  • Add go style expressions for multichecker matching. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/152
  • Upgrade juju/utils package to v2 by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/153
  • Fix performance issue with using collstats. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/154
  • Only use mmapv1 args for mmap storage engine by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/155
  • Only use maxTransactionLockRequestTimeoutMillis for mongo 4 by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/156
  • Update to use juju/mgo/v2 repo by @wallyworld in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/158
  • Ensure that the namespaced collections in the logs db are removed during teardown. by @achilleasa in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/160
  • Allow suites that depend on MgoSuite to disable cleanup. by @hpidcock in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/162

  • @ycliuhw made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/138
  • @timClicks made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/144
  • @SimonRichardson made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/testing/pull/145

releases.title: juju-restore v0.9
releases.body:
This release extends juju-restore to support downgrading a controller by restoring a backup taken before the controller was upgraded. This is prevented by default, but can be enabled by passing the --allow-downgrade option.

v0.9 also adds auto-loading credentials from the current machine’s agent.conf file, and fixes a bug (#12) in the code that miscounted how many HA nodes are in a backup.

releases.title: v1.0.2
releases.body:
What’s Changed

  • improved documentation and add the “Available” function explain. by @zhuCheer in https://github.com/juju/ratelimit/pull/29
  • Fix bonus tokens by function adjustavailableTokens (#31) by @kingsamchen in https://github.com/juju/ratelimit/pull/31

New Contributors

  • @zhuCheer made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ratelimit/pull/29
  • @kingsamchen made their first contribution in https://github.com/juju/ratelimit/pull/31

Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/ratelimit/compare/v1.0.1…v1.0.2

Changed

  • Upgraded jaaslib to remove request for revision-info on Charmstore requests.
  • Series list has been updated to include new OS series.
  • Added Prettier to the codebase to format .scss files.
  • Update to Xterm 3.8.0.
  • Browserify has been replaced with Webpack which also now builds the SCSS files.
  • Update the canvas to use the existing svg sprites.
  • Removed unused svg assets from the build/dist.
  • GUI is now being served by Flask.
  • YUI is now served as a bundled asset in two files to reduce total number of assets.
  • Replace components with juju-react-components.

Fixed

  • Forced Cloud facade to v2 to support UpdateCredentials method.
  • Updated broken links in deployment flow.
  • Broken GCP cloud logo in Firefox.
  • Repeating port values on Status pane.
  • Broken styles on the Status pane.
  • Searches without query text would reload forever.
  • Replaced Juju mailing list with Discourse link.

Removed

  • Entity details pages no longer have sticky headers.
  • It’s no longer possible to deploy k8s charms via the GUI.

Changed

  • Updated React to 16.5.2 and remaining dependencies.
  • Updated Profile section to use latest styling from Vanilla Framework.

Fixed

  • Status component is now more resilient to missing data.
  • Opening bundle readme from grouped links in inspector application list now works with bundles deployed from the Juju CLI with Juju 2.5.
  • Login button will now consistently show while not logged in in JAAS.

Added

  • Applications deployed via a bundle will now be grouped in the inspector with easy access to their details pages and their post deployment content.
  • Send analytics ping when exporting bundle.

Changed

  • Expand eslint linting rules. Use –fix on save to auto format into the correct syntax.
  • Continued worked on making React components sharable.

Removed

  • Beta status notice has been removed.

Fixed

  • Ensure that IP address display correctly on the Profile page.
  • Export bundles with series information for applications to fix multi-series deployment issues when the model has a different series than the application and specified machine.
  • If a charm cannot be found in the charm store, do not fail when trying to read it from the endpoints map.
  • Importing a bundle file has been disabled when in read-only mode.
  • Post deployment component now correctly updates and handles no-get-started gracefully.
  • Fix post deployment so that it shows even if the bundle is modified.
  • The GUI now passes the correct flags to destroy unused storage instances when destroying a model.

releases.title: v1.0.0
releases.body: Full Changelog: https://github.com/juju/gojsonschema/commits/v1.0.0

What’s Changed

This is a bug-fix/patch release for ops 1.5 advancing the Operator Framework in a number of key areas including:

Typing

Typing is now complete for all ops modules and static checks for all using pyright.

  • Typing framework.py by @PietroPasotti in #772
  • Typed ops.pebble.py by @PietroPasotti in #773
  • Typing charm.py by @PietroPasotti in #791
  • Fix model types by @PietroPasotti in #810
  • Typing main by @PietroPasotti in #811
  • Typed ops/testing.py by @PietroPasotti in #828

Documentation

Various documentation improvements.

  • Update docs for unset param in update_config by @swalladge in #768
  • cleaned up logging output by @PietroPasotti in #797
  • Fix docstring by @zmraul in #802
  • Added further documentation to define_event function in framework.py #830 by @nishant-dash in #831
  • Documented and checked ActionEvent.set_results with “Stdout” key by @PietroPasotti in #809
  • doc fix for config-changed by @PietroPasotti in #804

Testing

The Harness now tries harder to behave like production code would.

  • Make Harness more strict in validating relation data contents (on write) by @PietroPasotti in #786
  • Address storage testing quirks by @rwcarlsen in #763
  • fixed issues with relation data read by @PietroPasotti in #795
  • Remove overzealous Harness.add_storage error check. by @rwcarlsen in #781
  • added config backend to simulate more closely juju’s own by @PietroPasotti in #787
  • Include departing unit info for harness-initiated events by @rwcarlsen in #790

Improved error reporting

  • Improved error message for invalid storage key usage by @rwcarlsen in #771
  • Better error for relation data access in relation-broken events by @rwcarlsen in #765
  • downgrade breaking-change exception to just a warning by @rwcarlsen in #822

Bugfixes

  • Fix incorrect kwarg handling in testing backend storage_list by @rwcarlsen in #820
  • Allow network-get to return hostnames where previously IPaddr were expected by @PietroPasotti in #823
  • Use –file for relation-set; avoid shell argument length limits by @rbarry82 in #805
  • Fixed bug in ops.Model where non-string keys could be used to write relation data by @PietroPasotti in #788

Misc

  • Added a very basic smoke test. Run it with tox -e smoke by @pengale in #800
  • require tests to pass on a commit before we publish it to pypi by @rwcarlsen in #815
  • Remove harcoded value for self.model_uuid by @Abuelodelanada in #782
  • Test observe(decorated-method) by @PietroPasotti in #808

New Contributors

  • @swalladge made their first contribution in #768
  • @zmraul made their first contribution in #802
  • @nishant-dash made their first contribution in #831

Full Changelog: https://github.com/canonical/operator/compare/1.5.2…1.5.3

This is a bug-fix/patch release for ops 1.5 addressing a few important issues including:

  • Fix harness model uuid to use the correct/current format used by juju (#782).
  • Include the missing departing unit attribute on relation-departed events when using the harness (#790).
  • Remove restrictive limits on the number and size of relation data items that can be set (#805).
  • Fix type annotations that were causing failures in Ubuntu xenial based environments - i.e. python 3.5 (#810).

Notably, this release was carefully crafted to not break your code. If it does - please complain loudly and we will address problems after completing a good, forceful facepalm.
This release mistakenly excluded one important bugfix. Please skip it - use 1.5.2 instead.
